skillTree.localised_description: This Tyrant is the size of several large creatures rolled into one. In fact, he ate those several large creatures just yesterday.
Mountains of gold and an overflowing meat-pot are bound to draw in the strongest of warriors.
A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Ogre Lord, their swords always ready to cut and carve.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(all units in army)

Recruit rank: +2 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The Great Maw protects and the Great Maw devours. Hiding in shadows, the meatbags cower!"
Snapping limbs and smashing skulls – it's all in a day's work for an Ogre Tyrant.
Rule number one of being a leader is to be far more terrifying than the next braggard who thinks they ought to take your place.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not enough to impose military defeat upon the foe, they must be brought to their knees through punitive taxation… unless they'd rather get in the meat-pot instead?
No enemy is immovable when in the path of a furious Ogre's charge.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
This Ogre's greed shall never be sated, for his stomach is as endless as his hunger.
A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
If the enormous size of this Ogre doesn't incite terror, his bloody, malevolent smile surely will.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Greasus Goldtooth was vexed to learn that his every word was no longer being obeyed. Thats not good...

effects.description:
Experience gain for units: +50% when fighting against Ogre Kingdoms
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +3 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Leadbelchers, Hobgoblins, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Hobgoblins, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Leadbelchers, Hobgoblins, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Leadbelchers, Hobgoblins, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Leadbelchers, Hobgoblins, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Hobgoblins, and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Ironguts, Hobgoblins, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ironguts, Hobgoblins, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Hobgoblins, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Hobgoblins, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Hobgoblins, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Ogre Hungerers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
One can never go hungry on a long march for as long as there are captives for the meat-pot.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -3% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -8% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee.
Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Butchery is an art. This one knows how to extract every last morsel worth eating from a carcass, leaving only bones behind them.
Though they risk killing the Ogres directly behind them, those fighters who like it spicy can propel themselves further with gassy emanations following a hearty meal.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The more meat you eat, the stronger and fatter you become, and therefore the harder you are to move from your chosen position.
There may or may not be a height difference between this one and his Ogreish colleagues, but in stature on the battlefield the divergence is most stark.
"Remember, lads, when Great Maw came 'e ate the night, shook the ground and burnt it with fire. That is 'oo we serve, not sum uvver power."
Smack them really hard!

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Faster you get to it, faster you eat!
Little Empire people scared. I say, “hokay, don’t bother me none.” They scared, they pay on time, they keep me fed.

effects.description:
Casualties captured post-battle: +10%
	(all units in army)

Armour: +5 for Maneaters units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Take the big one first.

effects.description:
Enemy weapon strength: -5%
	(enemy characters in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Eat too much, thats all.
